citations.narrative:
The facility is not adequately cleaning enclosures. An enclosure housing 12 piglets contains an excessive amount of fecal
material covering approximately 75% of the floor space. The spaces that are not covered in feces are scattered and not
sufficiently large enough to allow all of the animals to lay down without laying in excrement. The fecal material is watery
and yellow/green in color. Additionally, dry and crusty fecal material was observed adhered to several of the animals
including on their back, rump, feet, and ears. The floor around the automatic waterer also contains fecal material and the
animals would have to walk in this area in order to drink water. Accumulations of excreta are harmful to the animals as
they can spread disease, attract pests, and cause unpleasant odors. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures
as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to
reduce odors. Correct by ensuring excreta is removed from the primary enclosures as often as necessary to minimize
disease hazards and reduce odors. Correct by end of business day, 30-AUG-2024.
A complete routine inspection was conducted starting on 28-AUG-2024. This inspection report is limited to the Direct non-
compliance identified during that inspection. An additional inspection report will be delivered with the other issues
identified during this inspection.
This inspection was conducted with facility representatives. The exit briefing was conducted on 28-AUG-2024 with facility
representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Eric Irvin, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
